note.p: Surgeon. Member, Royal College of Surgeons, 1841; fellow, 1844. Assistant surgeon, Royal Navy, 1841; surgeon 1848. Surgeon to the dispensary of the Samaritan Free Hospital for Women and Children, 1854. Hunterian Professor, Royal College of Surgeons, 1877; vice-president, 1879; president, 1883. Perfected techniques for ovariotomy and adopted Listerian antisepsis from 1878. Knighted, 1883.
